questions.answer_description: The objective of the Sprint is to produce a shippable Increment at the end of each Sprint so that the team can effectively inspect and adapt accordingly.

choices.B: A team of engineers, testers, business analysts, technical architects and functional managers.
choices.C: A group of full-stack developers shared across multiple teams.
choices.A: Cross-skilled individuals who are able to do all the work necessary to deliver a shippable Increment at the end of the Sprint.
choices.D: A team of skilled developers that can effectively multi-task on multiple Product Backlog items at the same time.

questions.question_text: A cross-functional Development Team is defined as:

questions.answer_description: The Development Team is responsible for managing and tracking the progress of their work during a Sprint
questions.question_text: Who should manage the tasks of Development Team during the Sprint?
A key concern when multiple Development Teams are working for the same Product Backlog is minimizing dependencies between teams.
questions.answer_description: Minimizing dependencies reduces complexity and enhances agility.

questions.question_text: The Scrum Master is no longer needed when teams become self-organized.

choices.C: There are no such activities. When the current Sprint ends, the new Sprint begins.
choices.D: Participate as a team member at the Sprint Retrospective.

questions.question_text: What Product Owner activities occur between the end of the current Sprint and the beginning of the next Sprint?
